body.name: Authenticate with Basic
body.toolTip: Authenticate with the backend service using Basic authentication. Use in the inbound section at API scope.

body.name: Authenticate with client certificate
body.toolTip: Authenticate with the backend service using a client certificate. Use in the inbound section at API scope.

body.name: Check HTTP header
body.content:
<check-header name="header name"
              failed-check-httpcode="http status code to return on failure"
              failed-check-error-message="error message to return"
              ignore-case="true | false">
    <value>value</value> <!-- if there are multiple possible allowed values, then add additional value elements -->
</check-header>
body.toolTip: Check header and return specified HTTP status code if it doesn't exist or match expected value. Works for both response and request headers â€“ policy can be applied in inbound or outbound sections at any scope.

body.name: Control flow
body.content:
<choose>
    <when condition="@(expression to evaluate)">
    </when>
    <when condition="@(expression to evaluate)">
    </when>
    <otherwise>
    </otherwise>
</choose>
body.toolTip: Conditionally apply policy statements based on the results of the evaluation of Boolean expressions. Use at any scope in the inbound and outbound sections.

body.name: Convert JSON to XML
body.toolTip: Convert request or response body from JSON to XML. Use in the inbound or outbound sections at API or Operation scopes.

body.name: Convert XML to JSON
body.content: <xml-to-json kind="javascript-friendly | direct" apply="always | content-type-xml" consider-accept-header="true | false"/>
body.toolTip: Convert request or response body from XML to either "JSON friendly" or "XML faithful" form of JSON. Use in the inbound or outbound sections at API or Operation scopes.

body.name: CORS
body.content:
<cors>
    <allowed-origins>
        <origin>*</origin> <!-- allow any -->
        <!-- OR a list of one or more specific URIs (case-sensitive) -->
        <origin>URI</origin> <!-- URI must include scheme, host, and port. If port is omitted, 80 is assumed for http and 443 is assumed for https. -->
    </allowed-origins>
    <allowed-methods> <!-- allow any -->
        <method>*</method>
    </allowed-methods>
    <allowed-headers> <!-- allow any -->
        <header>*</header>
    </allowed-headers>
</cors>
body.toolTip: CORS stands for cross-origin resource sharing. Add CORS support to an operation or an API to allow cross-domain calls from browser-based clients. Use in the inbound section only.

body.name: Find and replace string in body
body.toolTip: Find a request or response substring and replace it with a different substring. Use in the inbound and outbound sections at any scope.

body.name: Forward request to backend service
body.toolTip: Forward request to the backend service using information in the context and receive a response, waiting no longer then specified timeout value. Use at any scope in the backend section.

body.name: Get from cache
body.content:
<cache-lookup vary-by-developer="true | false" vary-by-developer-groups="true | false" downstream-caching-type="none | private | public" must-revalidate="true | false" allow-private-response-caching="@(expression to evaluate)">
    <vary-by-header>Accept</vary-by-header> <!-- should be present in most cases -->
    <vary-by-header>Accept-Charset</vary-by-header> <!-- should be present in most cases -->
    <vary-by-header>Authorization</vary-by-header> <!-- should be present when allow-authorized-response-caching is "true"-->
    <vary-by-header>header name</vary-by-header> <!-- optional, can repeated several times -->
    <vary-by-query-parameter>parameter name</vary-by-query-parameter> <!-- optional, can repeated several times -->
</cache-lookup>
body.toolTip: Perform cache lookup and return a valid cached response when available. Appropriately respond to cache validation requests from callers. Use anywhere in the inbound section at Product, API, or Operation scopes.

body.name: Get value from cache
body.content: <cache-lookup-value key="@(expression to evaluate)" default-value="@(expression to evaluate)" variable-name="name of a variable to put response into" />
body.toolTip: Perform cache lookup and returned value under the key, if available, or default. If value is not present and no default is specified, variable will not be set. Use at any scope in any section except <backend>.

body.name: JSONP
body.toolTip: Add support for JSONP to an operation or an API to allow cross-domain calls from JavaScript browser-based clients. Use in the outbound section only.

body.name: Limit call rate per key
body.content:
<rate-limit-by-key calls="number" renewal-period="seconds" 
    counter-key="expression like @(context.Subscription.Id) or a constant string"
    increment-count="optional, by default = 1"
    flexible-retry-window="optional, by default = false"
/>
body.toolTip: Arrest usage spikes by limiting calls and/or bandwidth consumption rate per calculated key. Use in the inbound section at any scope.

body.name: Limit request processing concurrency level
body.content:
<limit-concurrency key="@(expression) or a constant string" max-count="10" >
</limit-concurrency>
body.toolTip: Limit how many calls may be processed in parallel for the duration of this policy's body.

body.name: Log to EventHub
body.content:
<log-to-eventhub logger-id ='logger-id'>
                 @( string.Join(",", DateTime.UtcNow, context.Deployment.ServiceName, context.RequestId, context.Request.IpAddress, context.Operation.Name) ) 
             </log-to-eventhub>
body.toolTip: Send custom messages to Event Hub. Use at any scope in the inbound or outbound sections.

body.name: Mask URLs in content
body.toolTip: Use in the outbound section to re-write response body links and Location header values making them point to the proxy. Use in the inbound section for an opposite effect. Apply at API or Operation scopes.

body.name: Mock Response
body.toolTip: Mock response based on operation responses samples/schemas. Use at any scope in the inbound or outbound sections.

body.name: Output trace information
body.toolTip: Output information into trace logs, if request is executed with tracing enabled.

body.name: Remove value from cache
body.toolTip: Remove value from cache under the key. Use at any scope in any section except <backend>.

body.name: Restrict caller IPs
body.toolTip: Allow calls only from specific IP addresses and/or address ranges. Forbid calls from specific IP addresses and/or address ranges. Use in the inbound section at any scope.

body.name: Retry
body.content:
<retry condition="@( decide whether retry is required )" count="10" interval="seconds">
    <!-- put retryable sequence here -->
</retry>
body.toolTip: Retry execution of the enclosed policy statements, if and until the condition is met. Execution will repeat at the specified time interval, up to the specified count.

body.name: Return response
body.content:
<return-response response-variable-name="existing response variable">
    <set-status code="code" reason="reason" />
    <set-header name="header name" exists-action="override | skip | append | delete">
    <value>value</value> <!-- for multiple headers with the same name add additional value elements -->
</set-header>
    <set-body>new body value as text</set-body>
</return-response>
body.toolTip: Abort pipeline execution and return the specified response directly to the caller. Use at any scope in the inbound and outbound sections.

body.name: Rewrite URL
body.toolTip: Convert request URL from its public form to the form expected by the web service. Use anywhere in the inbound section at Operation scope only.

body.name: Send one way request
body.content:
<send-one-way-request mode="new | copy">
    <set-url>service URL to call</set-url>
    <set-method>GET</set-method>
    <set-header name="header name" exists-action="override | skip | append | delete">
        <value>value</value> <!-- for multiple headers with the same name add additional value elements -->
    </set-header>
    <set-body>new body value as text</set-body>
</send-one-way-request>
body.toolTip: Send provided request to the specified URL, without waiting for response. Use at any scope in the inbound and outbound sections.

body.name: Send request
body.content:
<send-request mode="new | copy" response-variable-name="name of a variable to put response into" timeout="seconds" ignore-error="false | true">
    <set-url>service URL to call</set-url>
    <set-method>GET</set-method>
    <set-header name="header name" exists-action="override | skip | append | delete">
        <value>value</value> <!-- for multiple headers with the same name add additional value elements -->
    </set-header>
    <set-body>new body value as text</set-body>
</send-request>
body.toolTip: Send provided request to the specified URL, waiting no longer then set timeout value. Use at any scope in the inbound and outbound sections.

body.name: Set backend service
body.toolTip: Change backend service where the incoming calls will be directed. Use in the inbound section only at any scope.

body.name: Set body
body.toolTip: Set message body to a specific string value. The policy has no effect on the Content-Type header value. Use at any scope in the inbound or outbound sections.

body.name: Set context variable
body.toolTip: Persist a value in a named context variable for later access from expressions. Use at any scope in the inbound and outbound sections.

body.name: Set HTTP header
body.content:
<set-header name="header name" exists-action="override | skip | append | delete">
    <value>value</value> <!-- for multiple headers with the same name add additional value elements -->
</set-header>
body.toolTip: Add a new header, change the value of an existing header or remove a header. Works for both response and request headers â€“ policy can be applied in inbound or outbound sections at any scope.

body.name: Set http proxy for backend request
body.toolTip: Specify http proxy location and credentials.

body.name: Set query string parameter
body.content:
<set-query-parameter name="param name" exists-action="override | skip | append | delete">
    <value>value</value> <!-- for multiple parameters with the same name add additional value elements -->
</set-query-parameter>
body.toolTip: Add a new query string parameter, change the value of an existing parameter or remove a parameter. Can be applied in the inbound section at any scope.

body.name: Set request method
body.toolTip: Change HTTP method to the specified value

body.name: Set status code
body.toolTip: Change HTTP status code to the specified value. Use at any scope in the outbound sections.

body.name: Set usage quota per key
body.content:
<quota-by-key calls="number" bandwidth="kilobytes" 
    renewal-period="period as number of seconds or xml timespan as 'PxxYxxMxxDTxxHxxMxxS' where xx are numbers" 
    counter-key="@(expression) or a constant string"
    first-period-start="optional, date as 2002-05-30T09:30:10-06:00"
    increment-condition="optional boolean expression like @( context.Response.StatusCode >= 200 && context.Response.StatusCode < 400 ) "
    increment-count="expression like @(context.Request.Method == "POST" ? 1:0) or a constant integer value. Optional, by default = 1."
/>
body.toolTip: Enforce a renewable or lifetime call volume and/or bandwidth quota per calculated key. Use in the inbound section at any scope.

body.name: Store to cache
body.toolTip: Cache responses according to the specified cache configuration. Use anywhere in the outbound section at Product, API, or Operation scopes.

body.name: Store value in cache
body.content: <cache-store-value key="@(expression to evaluate)" value="@(expression to evaluate)" duration="seconds" />
body.toolTip: Store value in cache under a key for duration. Use at any scope in any section except <backend>.

body.name: Transform XML using an XSLT
body.content:
<xsl-transform>
			<parameter name="User-Agent">@(context.Request.Headers.GetValueOrDefault("User-Agent","non-specified"))</parameter>
			<xsl:stylesheet version="1.0" xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform">
				<xsl:output method="xml" indent="yes" />
				<xsl:param name="User-Agent" />
				<xsl:template match="* | @* | node()">
					<xsl:copy>
						<xsl:if test="self::* and not(parent::*)">
							<xsl:attribute name="User-Agent">
								<xsl:value-of select="$User-Agent" />
							</xsl:attribute>
						</xsl:if>
						<xsl:apply-templates select="* | @* | node()" />
					</xsl:copy>
				</xsl:template>
			</xsl:stylesheet>
		</xsl-transform>
body.toolTip: Transform request or response body using XSLTransform. Use in the inbound, outbound and on-error sections at any scope.

body.name: Validate JWT
body.content:
<validate-jwt header-name="Insert HTTP Header Name here" failed-validation-httpcode="401" failed-validation-error-message="Unauthorized">
    <issuer-signing-keys>
        <key>Base64 Encoded Key 1</key>
         <!-- if there are multiple possible allowed values, then add additional value elements -->
    </issuer-signing-keys>
    <audiences>
        <audience>Audience 1</audience>
         <!-- if there are multiple possible allowed values, then add additional value elements -->
    </audiences>
    <issuers>
        <issuer>Issuer 1</issuer>
         <!-- if there are multiple possible allowed values, then add additional value elements -->
    </issuers>
    <required-claims>
        <claim name="claim1" match="all">
            <value>value1</value>
            <value>value2</value>
        </claim>
         <!-- if there are multiple possible allowed values, then add additional value elements -->
    </required-claims>
</validate-jwt>
body.toolTip: Check and validate a JWT in a header or query parameter. Use in the inbound section at any scope.

body.name: Wait for...
body.toolTip: Wait for all or any of the send request policies to complete before proceeding. Use at any scope in the inbound and outbound sections.
